purpleculture_pinyin:
tái
Taiwan (abbr.); platform; stage; terrace; stand; support; station; broadcasting station; classifier for vehicles or machines
Тайвань (сокр.); Платформа; сцена; терраса; стоять; поддерживать; станция; радиостанция; классификатор для транспортных средств или машин

heisig_chinese_memo: Until you get the crown in graffiti (good skills) with an aerosol can you can't do graffiti in Taiwan.

tái: (сущ) (сокр.) Тайвань
tái: (сущ) станция, служба; официальный пост; (книжн.) Вы, Ваш
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Until you get the crown in graffiti (good skills) with an aerosol can you can't do graffiti in Taiwan.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from "之" from "宀". " Zhi " is a sound symbol, and "宀" means it is related to a building. The text of the Warring States Period is from " room " to " zhi ". From the " Rock " and the " chamber similar" sense. Later, the sound symbol " Zhi " in the upper half of " Taiwan " was added from " kou " to the current " Taiwan ". "Shuowen" thinks that the word " Tai " "from high to save" means that the upper half of " room " is combined with the shape of " kou ". (Yao Xuan)

The original meaning of " Taiwan " is a tall and flat building in all directions. "Er Ya. "Shi Gong": "Four squares but high is called Taiwan." "Shuowen": "Taiwan, see the four directions but high." An example such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Five Years of Gong Xi": "The public looked at the new moon, and then climbed to the viewing platform to look forward to." "Zigao" Jane 11: "Swim on Yangtai."

Oracle is used as a verb. "East of Flowers" 502: "Taiwan.", "Taiwan in the south." " Taiwan " means Taiwan. (Yao Xuan)

"Behind the stage " generally refers to equipment or objects above the ground. For example, Du Mei's "A Fang Gong Fu" in the Tang Dynasty: "The singing stage is warm and the spring is mellow." Lu Zhaolin's poem "Meihualuo": "Because the wind enters the dance sleeves, the miscellaneous powder turns to the dressing table."

" Taiwan " means sedge, also known as husband's beard. "Er Ya. Shi Cao": "Taiwan, Husband." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Nanshan has Taiwan": "Nanshan has Taiwan, Beishan has Lai." Mao Chuan: "Taiwan, husband must also be." Kong Yingda Shu: "Old saying that husband must be, sedge is also. It can be a lilac." Another example is "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi "Xijing Fu": "Wang Chupintai, Rong Kui carries sheep."

" Taiwan " was also used as the name of the ancient low-ranking post. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. The Seventh Year of Zhaogong": "There are ten days in the sky, and ten grades in people. The next is so in the matter, the superior is the same god. Therefore, the king, the minister, the minister, the minister, the scholar, the soap, the sapon, the prince, the minister Ministers, servants of bureaucrats, servants of servants Taiwan." Kong Yingda said, "Taiwan, for the audience, we have a micro-name." "Book of Later Han. Biography of the Ten Kings of Guangwu: "Yu Ma Tai Li, should be a science product." Li Xian's note: "Taiwan, Li, low-ranking."

" Taiwan " was also used as an official signature in ancient times. Such as "Han Shu. "Bao Guan Gong Qing Biao": "One is Zhongcheng, in the Lantai in the hall, holding the secretary of the book." "Lantai" is the palace library of the Han Dynasty. Another example is "Sui Shu. "Hundred Officials": "Yushitai, built by Liang Guochu, placed a doctor, the first year of Tianjian, and renamed Zhongcheng. Place one person, supervise the division of Bailao."

" Taiwan " is also a respectful name for others. In ancient times, subordinates were called "Xiantai" and "Tangtai". Friends or peers respectfully call each other "brother stage" or "offstage." Such as Hong Sheng in the Qing Dynasty "Eternal Life Palace. Jin Guo": "Gently let go under the watchtower."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from "之" from "宀". " Zhi " is a sound symbol, and "宀" means it is related to a building. The original meaning is a tall and flat building in all directions.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「之」從「宀」。「之」是聲符，「宀」表示與建築物有關。戰國文字從「室」，「之」聲。從「宀」與從「室」意義相近。後來「臺」上半的聲符「之」字下又增從「口」，逐漸演變為現在的「臺」。《說文》以為「臺」字「从高省」，是把「室」的上半跟「口」形結合成一部分而言。（姚萱）

　　「臺」的本義是四方高而平的建築物。《爾雅．釋宮》：「四方而高曰臺。」《說文》：「臺，觀四方而高者。」例子如《左傳．僖公五年》：「公既視朔，遂登觀臺以望。」《上博二．子羔》簡11：「遊於央臺之上。」

　　甲骨文用作動詞。《花東》502：「臺。」、「臺于南。」「臺」表示作臺。（姚萱）

　　「臺」後泛指高出地面的設備或物體。如唐代杜枚〈阿房宮賦〉：「歌台暖響，春光融融。」盧照鄰〈梅花落〉詩：「因風入舞袖，雜粉向妝臺。」

　　「臺」表示莎草，又名夫須。《爾雅．釋草》：「臺，夫須。」如《詩．小雅．南山有臺》：「南山有臺，北山有萊。」毛傳：「臺，夫須也。」孔穎達疏：「舊說夫須，莎草也。可為蓑笠。」又如《文選．張平子〈西京賦〉》：「王芻莔臺，戎葵懷羊。」

　　「臺」也用作古代賤職之稱。如《左傳．昭公七年》：「天有十日，人有十等。下所以事上，上所以共神也。故王臣公，公臣大夫，大夫臣士，士臣皁，皁臣輿，輿臣隸，隸臣僚，僚臣僕，僕臣臺。」孔穎達疏引服虔曰：「臺，給臺下，微名也。」《後漢書．光武十王列傳》：「輿馬臺隸，應為科品。」李賢注：「臺、隸，賤職也。」

　　「臺」又用作古代官署名。如《漢書．百官公卿表》：「一曰中丞，在殿中蘭臺，掌圖籍秘書。」「蘭臺」是漢代宮廷藏書處。又如《隋書．百官志》：「御史臺 ，梁國初建，置大夫，天監元年，復曰中丞。置一人，掌督司百僚。」

　　「臺」亦是對別人的尊稱。古代下屬稱上級「憲臺」、「堂臺」。朋友或同輩之間尊稱對方「兄臺」、「臺下」。如清代洪昇《長生殿．進果》：「望臺下輕輕放手。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「之」從「宀」。「之」是聲符，「宀」表示與建築物有關。本義是四方高而平的建築物。

tai2
HSK 4: 檯,台,抬,臺,颱
(Simplified: 台)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A man 吉 standing on a raised 至 dais 冖
  • ⿳ Above to middle and below
    • 吉 [ jí ] lucky, propitious, good
    • 冖 [ mì ] cover
    • 至 [ zhì ] reach, arrive; very, extremely
①高平的建築物：亭臺樓閣。
②像臺的東西，器物的座子：井臺。窗臺。燈臺。
③敬辭，用於稱呼對方或與對方有關的事物：臺鑒。臺甫。
④量詞：一臺戲。
⑤臺灣省的簡稱：臺胞。臺幣。
⑥桌子、案子：寫字檯。
⑦發生在太平洋西部熱帶海洋上的一種極猛烈的風暴，稱“颱風”。
⑧姓氏。

臺階 [ tái jiē ]: steps; flight of steps; step (over obstacle); fig. way out of an embarrassing situation; bench (geology)

臺字的基本解释

臺
tái
见“台1”①臺⑤。

臺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tái］
［《廣韻》徒哀切，平咍，定。］
“坮1”的今字。亦作“籉1”。“台5”的繁体字。
(1)高而上平的方形建筑物。供观察眺望用。
(2)凡高于地面而上平的物体均可称台。
(3)指作底座用的物体。
(4)盘子的俗称。
(5)比喻政治舞台。参见“臺下”。
(6)通“始”。
(7)古代中央政府的官署。常指御史台。
(8)指朝廷、禁中。
(9)旧时用为对高级地方官吏或同辈人的尊称。
(10)古代一种地位很低下的奴隶。
(11)泛指奴仆。参见“臺隸”。
(12)莎草。一名夫须。可制蓑笠。
(13)清代邮驿的一种。
(14)量词。
(15)姓。汉有台崇。见《後汉书·献帝纪》。

臺字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【至字部】　臺； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1002第05
〔古文〕?㙵【廣韻】徒哀切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】堂來切，?音苔。【說文】觀四方而高者。【釋名】臺，持也。築土堅高，能自勝持也。【爾雅·釋宮】闍謂之臺。【註】積土四方也。【禮·月令】仲夏之月，可以處臺榭。【疏】積土爲之，所以觀望。【五經要義】天子三臺，靈臺以觀天文，時臺以觀四時，圃臺以觀鳥獸。　又【古今注】城門皆築土爲之。累土曰臺，故亦謂之臺門。　又官名。【正字通】袁紹傳，三臺註：漢官尚書爲中臺，御史爲憲臺，謁者爲外臺。又漢百官表註：禮樂官知禮容，故禮部稱容臺。又王彥威爲曲臺新禮三十卷：故太常稱曲臺。又漢秘書監曰芸臺，唐改祕書爲麟臺，唐百官志門下省曰鸞臺，宋銀臺司掌受天下奏狀。　又【博雅】臺，支也。　又賤者之稱。【左傳·昭七年】僕臣臺。【註】皁輿，隷僕之至?者也。【孟子】蓋自是臺無饋也。【註】臺，賤官，主使令者。又【輟耕錄】婢役于婢者，謂之重臺。【蘇軾·梅花詩】天敎桃李作輿臺。　又【博雅】臺，輩也。　又【揚子·方言】臺，敵延也。東齊海岱之閒曰臺

station
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tái］
["Guangyun" is only mournful, flat and fixed. ]
The present word for "坮1". Also known as "籉1". Traditional characters for "台5".
(1) A square building that is high and flat. For observation and viewing.
(2) Anything that is flat above the ground can be weighed.
(3) Refers to the object used as a base.
(4) The common name of the plate.
(5) A metaphor for the political arena. See "offstage".
(6) Through "beginning".
(7) The official office of the ancient central government. Often refers to Yushitai.
(8) Refers to the imperial court and the forbidden.
(9) In the past, it was used as a respectful name for senior local officials or peers.
(10) A kind of slave of very low status in ancient times.
(11) Refers generally to slaves. See "Tai Li".
(12) Cyperus. A husband must be. Can be used to make the lion.
(13) A kind of post in the Qing Dynasty.
(14) Quantifiers.
(15) Last name. There is Tai Chong in the Han Dynasty. See "Book of the Later Han·Xiandi Ji".

[Ancient text]? 㙵 [Guang Yun] I’m sorry to cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Come to cut it,? Yin Moss. [Speaking of texts] The one who is high in all directions. [Release name] Taiwan, hold it. Building the soil is strong, and it can be self-sustaining. 【Erya·Shigong】Tai weizhitai. 【Note】Filling the earth in all directions. 【Rite·Month Order】On the Midsummer Moon, you can be on the terrace. 【Sparse】Pile up soil for it, so wait and see. [Keywords of the Five Classics] There are three emperor towers, Lingtai for astronomy, Shitai for four o'clock, and Putai for birds and beasts.　[Ancient and Modern Note] The gates are all built with earth. Tired soil is called Taiwan, so it is also called Taiwan Gate.　Also official name. [Zhengzitong] Yuan Shao's biography, three stations Note: The official book of the Han Dynasty is Zhongtai, Yushi is Xiantai, and those who greet are outside Taiwan. Note to the list of hundreds of officials in the Han Dynasty: The officials of rituals and music know etiquette, so the Ministry of Ritual is called Rongtai. Wang Yanwei also made 30 new rituals for Qutai: So it is often called Qutai. The secretary of the Han Dynasty supervised Yuntai, the secretary of the Tang Dynasty changed the secretary to Lintai, Tang Baiguanzhi was called Luantai, and Song Yintai was the master of the world.　[Bo Ya] Taiwan, support.　It's also called the cheap. [Zuo Zhuan·Shao Qi Nian] Servant Terrace. [Note] Zaoyu, who is also the most important servant. [Mencius] Gai is no feeder. 【Note】Taiwan, low-ranking official, chief envoy. Also [stop farming record] the maidservant at the maidservant is called a heavy stage. 【Su Shi·Plum Blossom Poems】Tianping Tao Li Zuo Yutai.　[Bo Ya] Taiwan, also generations.　【Yangtze Dialect】Taiwan, the enemy is also Yan.
